Mouth; /the mouth as the organ of speech or voice, hence, speech, utterance; the mouth as the means of eating, tasting, etc., hence, a person as a consumer of food or as a unit in census-taking. b) An opening resembling or likened to a mouth; the opening of a cup, muzzle or bore of a rifle, width of a pipe or tube; mountain pass, opening of a gulch or ravine, narrow mountain valley; embouchure. c) Speicial idiomatic usage. -- ama ber jarixu. To utter a word, say, speak; to promise; to speak evil of, slander. See also b. -- jeketei. Having a big mouth; talking big, bragging. --n deger-e. In words ( an opposed to actions). --n kele. Oral or colloquial language. --n u ajas ijer keleky. To say whatever comes ütto one's head. --n u uran zokijal. Folklore. -- øgky. To give a promise. -- saitai kymyn. Having a sharp or acid tongue ( of people); hard-mouthed (of horses). -- ygei mori. A tender-mouthed horse. -- xoγusun. Empty words. -- γarxu. For a breach, gap, or passage to open.
